task_summary: The robot is instructed to pick up a disk from a shelf using a sequential manipulation policy; the scene involves perception, approach, grasp, and transfer steps visible across nine frames.

task_long_description.overview: This episode consists of a robotic arm executing the 'pick the disk' instruction using visual guidance and manipulation primitives. The scene shows the robot starting remotely from the shelf, incrementally approaching and aligning with the front right disk. The robot opens its gripper, computes a suitable top grasp, aligns, grasps the disk with a moderate force and retreats. All steps unfold in a tidy workspace, with a dark cubby shelf and several visible cylindrical disks. No human interference is present; process constraints are clear visibility and precise disk targeting.
preconditions: Robot arm and gripper are initialized.
Disk is located on the shelf and visually accessible.
No unexpected obstacles between robot and disk.
stepwise_plan: Confirm disk visibility or acquire using camera.
Move above the disk with vertical clearance.
Compute a top grasp pose for the disk.
Approach and align with the disk at fine tolerance.
Open the gripper to pre-grasp width.
Execute grasp at the computed pose.
Verify disk is held in the gripper.
success_criteria: Disk reliably grasped and elevated from shelf.
No collision with shelf or workspace.
Disk fully encircled by gripper fingers.
Robot retreats with disk in gripper.
failure_and_recovery: Failure: Disk not detected due to occlusion.
Recovery: Retry detection via visual search.
Failure: Grasp pose unreachable or unstable.
Recovery: Recompute alternate grasp pose and retry.
Failure: Gripper fails to close or does not hold disk.
Recovery: Open gripper, reposition, and repeat approach.
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates when robot successfully retreats with disk inside gripper and no further manipulation is required.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if disk is currently visible.
Attempts to detect disk in workspace.
Moves gripper above the disk at 5cm offset.
Computes a top grasp pose for disk.
Approaches and aligns gripper to disk with fine tolerance.
Retreats gripper with disk 10cm from shelf.

failure_modes: Disk not visible due to occlusion or lighting.
Grasp not stable; disk drops on closure.
recovery_strategy: Retry detection if disk not found.
Recompute grasp pose if approach fails.
Reopen gripper and repeat phases on grasp failure.
assumptions: Instruction specifies 'disk'; frames confirm the gripper targets the front right disk.
No explicit force or time parameters provided in instruction; defaults used.
Visual evidence shows top grasp suitable for disk geometry; 'top' used in BT.
Disk assumed unlabeled but visually and functionally matching instruction.
No place or transfer beyond retreat required per frames and instruction.
